intro: Silene praedichotoma, commonly known as the prairie catchfly, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and prairies. It has hairy stems and leaves that are lance-shaped with a rough texture. Silene praedichotoma is an herbaceous perennial that plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
